properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Early-season snowfall expected. Locations: portions of central, western and northern Labrador. Time span: Thursday morning through Friday night. Remarks: The first accumulating snow of the season is expected to arrive on Thursday. The snow will start in western and northern areas Thursday morning and then spread eastward late in the day. In some areas the precipitation will mix with or stay as rain, especially along the coast and near Lake Melville, where temperatures will likely be a degree or two warmer. In addition, strong north to northwest winds will accompany the wintry mix. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-08T00:13:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T08:14:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4170541612.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity, Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River, Churchill Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update To The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Unorganized Hamlet Of Lac Vert
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Unorganized Hamlet of Lac Vert. This advisory is for the Unorganized Hamlet of Lac Vert and for any individuals who may access water from the Lac Vert water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-10-20T09:00:00-06:00

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Early season snowfall expected. Locations: portions of central, western and northern Labrador. Snowfall amount: generally 5 to 10 cm can be expected. Time span: Thursday morning through Friday night. Remarks: The first accumulating snow of the season is expected to arrive on Thursday. The snow will start in western and northern areas Thursday morning and then spread eastward late in the day. In some areas the precipitation will mix with or stay as rain, especially along the coast and near Lake Melville, where temperatures will likely be a degree or two warmer. In addition, strong north to northwest winds will accompany the wintry mix. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-08T10:46:01-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage frost-sensitive fruit trees and vegetable plants. Temperatures will fall slightly below the freezing mark in these areas overnight Thursday to Friday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-08T11:26:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T19:27:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2242985123.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds gusting up to 80 km/h today. A cold front passing through Southern Ontario will bring strong, gusty winds beginning this morning. Winds will become northwesterly and gradually taper late this afternoon into this evening. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Some localized power outages are also possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-08T03:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T14:41:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3345420434.2020
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, Dunnville - Caledonia - Haldimand, Picton - Sandbanks Park, Niagara Falls - Welland - Southern Niagara Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall is expected. Locations: south coast of Newfoundland. Total rainfall: Generally 20 to 40 mm with the possibility of exceeding 50 mm in some areas. Time span: until Friday morning. Remarks: Periods of rain could be heavy at times tonight. The rain is expected to taper off to showers late on Thursday, then end before morning on Friday. At this time, there remains some uncertainty on the total rainfall amount over the inland portions of the southwest. Rainfall warnings may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-08T10:24:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T18:25:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1590981765.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intense low pressure system over Southampton Island continues to give strong northwest winds to Chesterfield Inlet, Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove with gusts to 90 km/h possible. Winds will continue strong into the evening then start to slowly diminish overnight as the low starts weakening. Other Kivalliq localities will also experience strong winds, but should remain below warning thresholds. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-08T11:23:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T19:24:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0519935440.2020
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet
properties.Author: Environment Canada

Locations: Iles de la Madeleine Time span: beginning late Thursday afternoon and continuing into Friday morning. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Locations: Churchill Falls. Time span: Thursday morning into Friday. Remarks: Rain is expected to change over to snow Thursday morning which could persist until Friday afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-08T10:46:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T18:47:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0917732038.2020
Area: Churchill Falls and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts. A cold front will sweep across eastern Ontario late this morning through early this afternoon and is expected to produce a line of thunderstorms that may become severe with strong wind gusts of 90 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-10-08T01:00:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T14:46:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2234252723.2020
Area: Tamworth - Sydenham - South Frontenac, Kingston - Odessa - Frontenac Islands, Napanee - Consecon, Picton - Sandbanks Park, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Westport - Charleston Lake, Brockville - Prescott, Gananoque - Mallorytown, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. An intense low pressure system over Southampton Island continues to give snow and very strong east winds to Sanirajak and Igloolik. While winds have subsided slightly, they continue to be quite strong, with gusts out of the east at 70 or 80 km/h, giving reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Conditions will continue to slowly improve later this evening with further improvement expected by Thursday morning. A further 2 to 4 cm of snow is possible tonight bringing total amounts up to the 10 to 20 cm range, although melting has likely occurred with temperatures near zero. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-08T10:59:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-07T19:30:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2351188431.2020
Area: Hall Beach, Igloolik
properties.Author: Environment Canada
